intro: Faramea subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged oppositely on the stems. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with white or pale pink petals. Faramea subsessilis is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
